title: Supreme Court Weighs Bankruptcy Discharges for Fraud by a Third Party
sub_head: The high court takes up whether debtors can use bankruptcy to wipe out a fraud judgment their partners are responsible for
body:
The Supreme Court will hear a dispute stemming from a San Francisco house-flipping project gone wrong that is expected to determine whether an innocent bankruptcy debtor can wipe out judgments for a fraud carried out by someone else.
The justices elected Monday to hear the case of a married couple who sold a house in 2008 for $2 million without disclosing water leaks and other problems to the buyer.
